column4: How do I (via terminal/synaptic package manager/firefox) upgrade Firefox on Ubuntu 9.10 to Firefox 3.6.x
that's the daily build and there's a PPa for that.. however it will break flash
how is it a daily build? I thought Firefox 3.6.3 has been out for a while - plus, flash is kinda broken atm doesn't register clicks sometimes.
the PPA version (at least the one I used) is considered a daily build.. updates every day.  and by broken flash I don't mean a little I mean totally non functional
ah that sucks :/ what about a stable 3.6.3? is that possible?
not sure.. couple of us here have dropped back to 3.5
cli.. command line.. in the gui it's know as terminal.. sortof
thought so - how do I get out of it if I accidently go into it?
actually a TTY I believe is the official term
F1-6 are tty's.. F7 is always gui
if you gui doesn't start you can do everything from cli.. google irssi as an IRC program.. just one example of  a terminal based program..
so ctrl + alt (1-6) all put it into TTY? what is TTY?
what's fun is after you get a little use to linux.. try using the tty for everything you do.. irc, email, browsing the web etc.. it can be done.
I'd rather not :P I'm a GUI lover.
at some point the skills there are good to have.
agreed but I'd prefer to dabble in terminal then full fledged.
same either way.. expicially when you can bounce back and forth
